author: Michael Larabel
description: The many power management subsystem updates and related changes have been merged for the in-development Linux 6.16 kernel...
title: Intel PTC, Intel EAS & AMD Requested CPU Min Freq Features Merged For Linux 6.16

author: Michael Larabel
description: Alpine Linux 3.22 is now available as the newest version of this Linux distribution popular for use with containers and embedded purposes due to its small, simple, and secure focus...
title: Alpine Linux 3.22 Replaces Gummiboot With systemd-efistub

author: Michael Larabel
description: The latest upstream Linux kernel improvement for AMD's Secure Encrypted Virtualization "SEV" is the introduction of a virtual TPM driver...
title: AMD Virtual TPM Driver Merged For Linux 6.16 To Enhance Confidential Computing

author: Michael Larabel
description: With how well the open-source and upstream AMD Radeon Linux graphics driver stack is these days between the mainline Linux kernel and Mesa, the Radeon Software for Linux packaged driver releases are not usually notable these days on Phoronix... The packaged Radeon Software for Linux drivers haven't been popular with gamers/enthusiasts in years given how good the upstream support is and those packaged bits mostly useful for those just running enterprise Linux distributions with older versions of Linux and Mesa. But the next Radeon Software for Linux packaged driver release is set to introduce a big change...
title: Radeon Software For Linux Dropping AMD's Proprietary OpenGL/Vulkan Drivers

author: Michael Larabel
description: For making use of AMDGPU user queue functionality, the latest Mesa user-space side work has been merged for Mesa 25.2 to enable support for high priority graphics user queues...
title: AMDGPU High Priority Graphics User Queue Support Merged For Mesa 25.2

author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel's Software Guard Extensions (SGX) updates for the in-development Linux 6.16 contain a fix so SGX is now less likely to cause a fatal machine check...
title: Intel SGX With Linux 6.16 Less Likely To Cause Fatal Machine Checks

author: Michael Larabel
description: As an alternative to Coredumps dumping to a file or a pipe connected to a user-mode helper process, Linux 6.16 is introducing the ability to send Coredumps over an AF_UNIX socket...
title: Coredump Socket Support Merged For Linux 6.16

author: Michael Larabel
description: Overnight Intel upstreamed their IPU7 firmware binaries into the linux-firmware.git repository where Linux distributions will then be able to pick them up for easy consumption. IPU7 is for their latest Image Processing Unit for some web cameras on their latest-generation Lunar Lake platform...
title: Intel IPU7 Firmware Binaries Upstreamed For Lunar Lake Webcameras

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the exciting EXT4 performance work, XFS atomic writes, and other exciting file-system pull requests submitted for the ongoing Linux 6.16 merge window, the Flash-Friendly File-System (F2FS) changes have been submitted and merged for this next kernel version...
title: F2FS Improvements Merged For Linux 6.16
